body_html:
@gunan As long as the different cuDNN version is the reason for them not working then I think a clear message to indicate to users there is a change is reasonable.

Just aware that some users with less patience than me may eventually upgrade to 1.3 and, unless you read the release notes, you may not realise that cuDNN requirements have changed. This could cause an increase in install error reports. I guess that's up to you what is sufficient to placate the issue!

Paging @mrry to perhaps see if he can edit his excellent check script to warn of incompatible cuDNN based on TF version as currently it identifies that cuDNN is installed but turns out it's the wrong version.
